intro: Ditassa obscura, commonly known as the dark ditassa, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruits are small, spherical berries that turn red when mature. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
